alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Northern San Joaquin Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued April 02 at 8:24PM PDT until April 04 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For Monday`s Wind Advisory, northwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For Tuesday`s Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 32 to 36 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Northern San Joaquin Valley and the far eastern Delta. * WHEN...For Monday`s Wind Advisory, from 11 AM to 8 PM PDT Monday. For Tuesday`s Frost Advisory, from 2 AM to 9 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lingering breezy winds should limit frost formation Monday morning, however, cold temperatures Tuesday morning will allow for area of frost. Gusty northwesterly winds will develop late Monday morning and persist into Monday evening.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: Carquinez Strait and Delta; Northern San Joaquin Valley
